TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebDisplayNameAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines the friendly name for a property of a Web Parts control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control provides a generic user interface (UI) that enables users to edit custom properties on <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> and server controls placed in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zones. The editing UI is provided for properties that are marked in the source code with the `WebBrowsable` attribute (from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> class). When a property is marked with this attribute, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control creates the editing UI based on the type of the property, and uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object if needed to convert the value in each editing control to the type of the property.
The `WebDisplayName` attribute (from the WebDisplayNameAttribute class) allows you to specify the text for the label that appears with each control in the editing UI.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the WebDisplayNameAttribute attribute to assign a display name to a property on a Web Parts control. The custom `UserJobType` property is given a friendly name "Job Type" to display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_113_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_113_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without a specified name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WebDisplayNameAttribute constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute.DisplayName%2A> property to an empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string displayName) cil managed

Docs.param: The friendly name to use in a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified display name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WebDisplayNameAttribute constructor sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute.DisplayName%2A> property to `displayName`. The `displayName` parameter is the value that will appear in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute> attribute to assign a display name to a property on a Web Parts control. The custom `UserJobType` property is given the friendly name "Job Type" to display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. The name is assigned through the WebDisplayNameAttribute constructor. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/7793e601-dc9d-4a50-89e2-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/7793e601-dc9d-4a50-89e2-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Represents an instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute.DisplayName%2A> property set to an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Default field returns the same result as calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of a property to display in a control.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> containing the value to display in a .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name to display in the control.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> containing the value to display in a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DisplayNameValue property gets or sets the same value that is accessed through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebDisplayNameAttribute.DisplayName%2A> property. The DisplayNameValue property is protected and therefore only accessible either within the class or through a derived class.
